document_title: Granulomatous pharyngitis: Causes, signs, prevention and treatment
subsection_content:
Granulomatous pharyngitis can occur in anyone, especially people with poor resistance
Granulomatous pharyngitis is a condition in which the pharyngeal mucosa is chronically inflamed, causing the lymphoid tissue in the back of the throat to swell, forming red or pink granules in the pharyngeal mucosa. The size of these seeds can vary in size, from the size of a pin head to a pea.(1)
Granulomatous pharyngitis appears in all subjects, all ages, and is especially common in people with weak resistance and weakened bodies.
subsection_title: viem hong hat.json. What is pharyngitis?
